item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race to noon Monday
item.description: The NASCAR Sprint Cup race at Watkins Glen International has been postponed because of rain and rescheduled for Monday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Back-to-back jacks earn Yanks sweep of BoSox
item.description: Johnny Damon and Mark Teixeira hit back-to-back homers in the eighth inning Sunday night, and the Yankees beat the Red Sox 5-2.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Bridgestone Invitational: Tiger Woods soars over Padraig Harrington to win
item.description: With another signature moment at Firestone, Tiger Woods won the Bridgestone Invitational on Sunday with a spectacular shot over water to a foot that sent him to a 5-under 65 and a remarkable rally over Padraig Harrington.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Collins overshadows Owens as Titans beat Bills
item.description: Kerry Collins was sharp and Vince Young tentative for the Tennessee Titans in overshadowing Terrell Owens' debut for the Buffalo Bills.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Chicago Blackhawks forward Patrick Kane faces theft of services, other charges
item.description: Blackhawks forward Patrick Kane, the top overall pick in the 2007 NHL draft, was arrested early Sunday morning in Buffalo, N.Y., and charged with theft of services, criminal mischief and robbery in the second degree after an incident with a cab driver.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Manager Ozzie Guillen vows retaliation if Chicago White Sox players get hit
item.description: White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen had a warning for the rest of the league: Hit our players and our pitchers will retaliate.

item.dc:creator: Buster Olney
item.title: Sources: Several teams interested in aquiring John Smoltz
item.description: Several teams have interest in acquiring John Smoltz, and major league sources say.

item.dc:creator: Adam Rittenberg
item.title: Police: Ex-Michigan Wolverine Justin Feagin in failed drug deal
item.description: Police reports show that Justin Feagin was dismissed from the Michigan football team after an alleged failed drug deal.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Russian investigators reopen Alexei Cherepanov probe
item.description: Prosecutors will reopen the investigation into the death of New York Rangers draft pick Alexei Cherepanov, who collapsed during a Continental Hockey League game last year in Russia.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tony Dungy: NFL coaches have inquired about Michael Vick
item.description: Tony Dungy says he's spoken to "quite a few" NFL coaches about Michael Vick.

item.dc:creator: Mike Sando
item.title: St. Louis Rams lose Donnie Avery for 4-6 weeks with foot injury
item.description: The St. Louis Rams expect to be without starting receiver Donnie Avery for four to six weeks after the second-year pro suffered a foot injury, coach Steve Spagnuolo told reporters Sunday.
